story:
Once upon a time, in a small town nestled between the mountains and the sea, there lived a kind and gentle man named Ahmed. Ahmed was a devout Muslim who always began and ended his day with prayer, and he made sure to teach his young daughter, Yasmine, the importance of faith and compassion.

One day, as Ahmed and Yasmine were walking home from the market, they came across a small, hungry kitten, mewing pitifully by the side of the road. Yasmine immediately bent down to pet the kitten, and Ahmed could see the longing in his daughter's eyes as she looked up at him.

"Father, can we keep the kitten?" Yasmine asked, her voice filled with hope.

Ahmed smiled and nodded. "Of course, my dear. But we must take good care of it and make sure it is healthy and happy."

So, Yasmine and Ahmed took the kitten home and named it Sabrina, after the patient and steadfast wife of the prophet Yusuf (peace be upon him). They fed Sabrina, gave her a warm place to sleep, and showed her love and affection.

As the days passed, Sabrina grew stronger and healthier, and she became a beloved member of the family. But one day, Sabrina didn't come home. Yasmine and Ahmed searched for her high and low, but she was nowhere to be found.

Yasmine was heartbroken, and Ahmed could see the sadness in her eyes. But he reminded her that everything happens for a reason, and that Allah has a plan for all of us.

Just then, there was a knock at the door. It was their neighbor, Ali, who had found Sabrina injured and alone by the side of the road. Ali had brought Sabrina to the local veterinarian, who had treated her wounds and given her medication.

Yasmine and Ahmed were overjoyed to see Sabrina again, and they thanked Ali for his kindness. From that day on, they made sure to keep a close eye on Sabrina and to always show her love and care.

And as Yasmine grew older, she learned the importance of compassion, patience, and faith, just as her father had taught her. And she knew that Allah was always watching over her and guiding her on the right path.

The end.

May this bedtime story inspire your child with the values of kindness, compassion, and faith. Goodnight!
